result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J. Gauger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 12 months, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ADDRESS INFO for Robert J. Gauger
Current: 1010 Ceape Ave, Oshkosh, WI 54901 United States  (Effective: 05-27-2016)
Prior: N5651 Co Rd W, Wild Rose, WI 54984 United States

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Robert J. Gauger in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he went back to work and states earnings to court. Court makes statement regarding defendant's options. Defendant requests extension to discuss matter with the DA. 
10:42 am Case recalled-Resolution reached and stated on the record.   Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: No Contest to Count 1 & No Contest to Count 3.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through,   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Court will allow for early termination after a period of 12 months. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert J. Gauger

Prior: N5477 County Road W, Wild Rose, WI 54984

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.    Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department if not already done so.

Case Called 10:13 AM: Defendant Robert J. Gauger in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel - has not yet contacted SPD for eligibility.  Court believes Def will qualify for services.  NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 10:10 am.
